intro: Cymopterus terebinthinus var. californicus, commonly known as the California terebinth, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbel flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a deep taproot system for water retention. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly bitter scent. The flowers, which appear in late summer, are white to pale yellow and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
